title: David Nieper: Can someone please ID the typeface(s) used in this logo?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133711im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/David%20Nieper_5452.jpg)

Thanks!

 [‹ Brother Printers font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133711/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46318 "Go to previous forum topic") [WaMu ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821133711/http:/www.typophile.com/node/46314 "Go to next forum topic")
author: satya

comments.content:
The D is most unusually formed. I don’t think I have seen those initials before. The N looks like it had the curls ’grafted’ on, and for that reason I am inclined to think the initials are hand-drawn. The rest of the lettering looks like it could come from either a script font, or an italic of a serif font, but they are not distinctive enough for me to recognize them.

- Mike Yanega
